param.name: yj_menu_sub_title
param.label: Sub title
param.description: Add your menu item description here.You can also include HTML

param.name: yj_menu_custom_class
param.label: Add custom css class
param.description: You can add custom css class to your new item elelment and syle it differently if needed.To affect the new elelment class add div.horiznav a.your_class_name OR div.horiznav div.your_class_name for modules, in custom.css or CURRENT_COLOR.css at the bottom of the file. Using !important property would make sure that the class is affected. Example: background:blue!important;

param.name: yj_group_holder
param.label: Act as group holder?
param.description: If selected yes , this will be the main group holder. Please assign this as a parent to all groups you want to be visible inside this menu item. Note that this can only be a Normal link , not module and not module position

param.name: yj_sub_group_width
param.label: Sub groups width
param.description: Sub groups width assigns width to Group holder sub groups.Example if you have 3 sub groups enter each group width.1 per line.

param.name: yj_item_type
param.label: Menu item type
param.description: You can select what type of the item this would be . Module, module position, Normal link. If this item is a group holder please leave default value.Normal link

param.name: yj_menu_show_title
param.label: Display link title, image and sub title if link type is module?
param.description: If set to NO Link title , link image and link description will not be displayed.This option is functional ONLY if link type is module or module position. This is usefull if you like to show only module with its tile. For example Login Form

param.name: yj_mod_id
param.description: Use Ctrl-click to select more than one item.
param.label: Select one or more module
param.sql: SELECT id, module, title FROM #__modules WHERE `client_id`=0 AND module != 'mod_mainmenu' ORDER BY position ASC

param.name: yj_position
param.description: Use Ctrl-click to select more than one item.
param.label: Select one or more position
param.sql: SELECT DISTINCT position FROM #__modules ORDER BY position ASC
